titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the George Bradford Brainerd photograph collection BCMS.0059
titlestmt.author: Diana Bowers-Smith

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-05-18 19:27:08 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

physdesc.extent: in 408 digital photographic images in tiff format.

did.materialspec: The digitized portions of this collection are available here.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Brainerd photograph collection, spanning 1845-1887, includes film positives from original glass plate negatives, duplicate negatives, contact prints from duplicate negatives, and mounted prints. Approximately 75 images in this collection are stereographs. Subjects include: street scenes, houses, landscapes, waterfront and parks.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers without restriction. The physical collection is unprocessed but a portion of the collection is available through the library's digital collections portal.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items in the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
